result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John R. Dawidziak

Atty Carlson was just appointed on this matter and requests a new date.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
8:31 AM Defendant John R. Dawidziak appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant would like counsel and would request time to seek a public defender.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

filed by Defendant requesting to appear via zoom for next hearing.

**Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on 09-01-2022: Approved.**

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to contact the Clerk of Courts office within 5 business days to sign the signature bond, if not a warrant will be issued.

09:53 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John R. Dawidziak appeared by zoom video means.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Check Case scheduled for August 4, 2022.  Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Filed by defendant - request to adjourn court date.
  **Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 07-26-2022. "Adjournment is denied as there is a victim in the matter. May appear via Zoom if he has complaint"
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on July 21, 2022
